ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Subjective severity 10/10, THI 80, TFI 82%; exacerbated by migraines and Chiari history.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Subjective sound intolerance 9/10; LDLs reduced to 80-95 dB HL.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: High-frequency Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Mild loss at 6-8 kHz in the left ear; normal hearing in the right ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Seizure Disorder / Epilepsy
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of epilepsy; partial seizure occurred during residual inhibition testing.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To quantify the functional and emotional impact of tinnitus (THI, TFI).
To assess thresholds up to 20 kHz, relevant for tinnitus.
To quantify sound tolerance levels for hyperacusis.
To characterize tinnitus pitch, loudness, and maskability.
To assess the integrity of the auditory pathway.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial audiological evaluation at an otolaryngology practice revealed normal hearing in the right ear and a mild high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss in the left ear. Middle ear function was normal bilaterally, and speech recognition was excellent.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing right (10-15 dB HL). Normal left through 4000 Hz, sloping to mild loss (30-40 dB HL) at 6000-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Excellent word recognition (100%) bilaterally; SRT 15 dB AU.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A tympanograms bilaterally, indicating normal middle ear function.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Reflexes present at normal levels bilaterally.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Comprehensive tinnitus and hyperacusis evaluation at the university clinic. Results confirmed catastrophic tinnitus impact and reduced sound tolerance. Testing was complicated by a partial seizure during the tinnitus evaluation.

tests.name: Self-report scales
tests.result_summary: THI score 80 (catastrophic); TFI score 82%. Indicates substantially reduced quality of life.

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDL/UCL)
tests.result_summary: Reduced loudness tolerance (80â€“95 dB HL) from 500 to 4,000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Tinnitus Evaluation
tests.result_summary: Included pitch/loudness match and minimal masking. During residual inhibition, patient experienced a partial seizure.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral Type A tympanograms, consistent with normal middle ear function.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Screening confirmed no changes in hearing sensitivity since prior testing.

proposed_items: Sound therapy using a 'sleep band' headband (soft, loose-fitting) to avoid in-ear devices.
Systematic program of sound therapy and counseling (Tinnitus Retraining Therapy protocol).
counseling_actions: Explained test results and the relationship between sound sensitivity and tinnitus.
Discussed the use of sound therapy to foster desensitization.
Encouraged discussion with neurologist regarding potential auditory triggers for seizures.
Recommended communicating outcomes with pain management and neurology providers.

red_flags_present: Partial seizure occurred during audiological testing

escalation.destination: Neurologist, Pain Management Specialist, and Mental Health Professional
escalation.rationale_short: To address seizure activity potentially triggered by sound and coordinate care for migraines and complex medical history.

follow_up_plan.objective: Review progress with medical specialists (neurology/pain management) and continue desensitization protocol.

expected_outcome: Patient met with neurologist and pain management doctors a few weeks after the visit.
Neurologist was more concerned with seizures than tinnitus management.
Pain management doctor encouraged continuation of the desensitization exercises provided by the clinic.
Pain management doctor recommended pool and physical therapies to improve quality of life.
Patient received Botox injections for migraines.
